channel.title: GPR Case Studies on Sandberg GPR
channel.description: Recent content in GPR Case Studies on Sandberg GPR

item.title: GPR bridge investigation
item.description: On bridges GPR can be used to map reinforcement, locate post-tensioned tendons, determine general construction detail, thickness of construction and much more…

item.title: Floor slab utility survey in a working office
item.description: How we used GPR for a floor slab utility survey in a working London office to locate services with minimal disruption to the office staff.

item.title: Construction and building defects in a London school
item.description: We used GPR to investigate construction detail and identify building defects, specifically if precast hollow core units had reinforcement within them and were filled with concrete.

item.title: Gas holder base thickness measurement
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR survey methods to determine the gas holder base thickness non-intrusively, with access to one side only.

item.title: Paddington train station platform survey
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR survey methods for a station platform survey and concourse area investigation at Paddington Station.

item.title: St Helen’s church – survey to locate voids in stone walls
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR to locate voids in stone walls up to 1m thick, comprising a stone inner and outer leaf, with a rubble fill.

item.title: Warehouse tendon location survey with on-site mark-up
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR tendon location survey methods for floor slab tendon location with in situ mark-up in a working warehouse.

item.title: Wellington monument investigation
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR to investigate the construction detail and understand this unique and somewhat complex Grade II listed monument.

item.title: Pad foundation location survey
item.description: How we used GPR to locate and map pad foundations, including construction detail, on a site in Waterloo.
